Jones St. Glenwood South Raleigh, NC 27603Phone: (919) 831-2811Web_Page: http://www.42ndstoysterbar.com/Notes: 42nd St. Oyster Bar & Seafood Grill The 42nd St. Oyster Bar is one of the truly famous eating establishments in North Carolina. In spite of all the stories and myths about the place, people could always come and have great steamed oysters and cold beer. The famous old place has developed the reputation of being one of the most enjoyable restaurants to frequent in the southern part of the United States. properties.name: Fosters American Grille
properties.description: 521 Daniels St. Cameron Village Raleigh, NC 27605Phone: (919) 821-5969Web_Page: http://www.fostersamericangrille.com/Notes: Restaurant:   Pricing level: $$ - $20 to $40 Additional Info: Free valet parking during lunch Food Categories:   American Hours:   Dinner   Late Night   Lunch It has brought an erstwhile restaurant and popular late night spot in the Village back to life. According to principal partner John Powers, many of the favorite dishes at the old Foster's (crab dip, house-made potato chips, shrimp and grits, and Southwest chicken pasta, to name a few) have been revived for the new menu. What's more, these dishes are being offered at the same prices as in 2004, when the original Foster's closed.

properties.name: Irregardless Cafe
properties.description: 901 W. Morgan St. Glenwood South Raleigh, NC 27603Phone: (919) 833-8898Notes: Restaurant:   Pricing level: $$ - $20 to $40 Additional Info: The Cafe features live music each night of the week and at Sunday Brunch. The Cafe is a venue location available on Saturdays during the day, Sunday evenings after 4:00 p.m. and all day Monday We can accommodate 125 guests comfortably with catering available. Group parties can easily be arranged with special menus to match budgets. Food Categories:   Middle Eastern   New American Hours:   Brunch   Dinner   Late Night   LunchOther: Before drizzles on plates or The Food Network, there was The Irregardless Cafe. Sure, our menu has changed and the place looks way different than it did in 1975. But we've always been a comfortable place with live music nightly, where folks can see old friends and enjoy scrupulously fresh, imaginatively prepared food. And that must be what keeps them coming back for more, irregardless of age. On Saturday nights, Irregardless features big band and jazz music and swing dancing, beginning at 9:30 p.m. Come for dinner and stay for a night of dancing.

properties.description: 8111 Creedmoor Rd. Ste. 111 Brennan Station Raleigh, NC 27613Phone: (919) 846-9846Web_Page: http://www.margauxsrestaurant.com/Notes: Restaurant:   Pricing level: $$ - $20 to $40 Hours:   Dinner   LunchOther: At Margaux's Restaurant in Raleigh we combine our ever-changing menu, a flare for impeccable service, an energetic ambience with a progressive decor and you will understand why Margaux's has remained a favorite for those from near and far for 15 years. We say it is the Perfect Fusion of a High-Energy Metropolis and Soulful Southern Hospitality. You'll say it's Downright Awesome! Come be a part of the dining experience and understand why we still stand strong after all these years.

properties.name: Posta Tuscan Grille
properties.description: 500 Fayetteville St. Raleigh, NC 27601Phone: (919) 227-3370Web_Page: http://www.postatuscangrille.com/Notes: Restaurant:   Pricing level: $$$ - $40 to $60 Additional Info: Breakfast Daily: 6:00pm - 11:00pm Lunch Daily: 11:00am - 2:00pm Dinner Nightly: 5:00pm - 10:00pm Food Categories:   Italian Hours:   Breakfast   Dinner   LunchOther: Tuscan Posta Grille is an authentic Tuscan style restaurant located in the Raleigh Marriott City Center. Posta Tuscan Grill combines fresh ingredients with traditional recipes for a dining experience that until now, was only available in our first restaurant in San Casciano, Italy. Marco and Gianni Betti, proudly invites you to taste the simple, flavorful dishes that have mad Italian and Tuscan cooking the most appreciated cuisine in the world. Posta Tuscan Grille brings to our community the same genuine, sincere cuisine of Tuscany. Enjoy the delicate blend of meats, fish, vegetables, spices, and condiments that for centuries have pleased the palate of the most demanding Florentines.

properties.name: Rockland Bar and Grill
properties.description: 3622 Rogers Road Wake Forest, NC 27587Phone: (919) 848-3812Web_Page: http://roccosnc.com/contact.phpNotes: Restaurant: Food Categories:   Italian Hours:   Dinner   LunchOther: casual eatery with a family-friendly atmosphere that's something of a cross between pizzeria and neighborhood pub, Rocco's sets the mood with bare tabletops and lots of booths, half a dozen beers on tap and a couple of flat screen TVs.  The menu follows suit with an offering of traditional veal, chicken, seafood and pasta dishes that will be familiar to fans of the Cinellis' other restaurants. New York-style pizzas are also available, as well as the family's locally famous thin-crusted Grandma's Pizza. Rocco's is open for lunch and dinner daily.

properties.name: The Third Place at Five Points
properties.description: 1811 Glenwood Ave. Five Points Raleigh, NC 27608Phone: (919) 834-6566Web_Page: http://www.thirdplacecoffee.com/Notes: Restaurant:   Pricing level: $ under $20 Food Categories:   Coffeehouse Hours:   Breakfast   Dinner   Late Night   LunchOther: Welcome to The Third Place, located at 1811 Glenwood Avenue in the Five Points area of Raleigh - a cozy and eclectic coffeehouse. Enjoy coffee, breakfast, sandwiches, vegetarian fare and yummy desserts surrounded by rich red Oriental rugs, warmly hued walls and exotic glass lanterns suspended from the antique tin ceiling. A full menu, with many items made right in the shop, is available from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. The name, The Third Place, comes from the book written by Ray Oldenburg in which he celebrates the 'third places' in our lives - after home and work, these are the places where people can relax in good company on a regular basis. We invite you to make us your 'third place'!
